segment.source: User State Migration Tool (USMT) Overview (Windows 10)
segment.target: User State Migration Tool (USMT) Overview (Windows 10)

segment.source: User State Migration Tool (USMT) Overview
segment.target: User State Migration Tool (USMT) Overview

segment.source: User State Migration Tool (USMT) Overview
segment.target: User State Migration Tool (USMT) Overview

segment.source: You can use User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 to streamline and simplify user state migration during large deployments of Windows operating systems.
segment.target: You can use User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 to streamline and simplify user state migration during large deployments of Windows operating systems.

segment.source: USMT captures user accounts, user files, operating system settings, and application settings, and then migrates them to a new Windows installation.
segment.target: USMT captures user accounts, user files, operating system settings, and application settings, and then migrates them to a new Windows installation.

segment.source: You can use USMT for both PC replacement and PC refresh migrations.
segment.target: You can use USMT for both PC replacement and PC refresh migrations.

segment.source: For more information, see Common Migration Scenarios.
segment.target: For more information, see Common Migration Scenarios.

segment.source: USMT enables you to do the following:
segment.target: USMT enables you to do the following:

segment.source: Configure your migration according to your business needs by using the migration rule (.xml) files to control exactly which files and settings are migrated and how they are migrated.
segment.target: Configure your migration according to your business needs by using the migration rule (.xml) files to control exactly which files and settings are migrated and how they are migrated.

segment.source: For more information about how to modify these files, see USMT XML Reference.
segment.target: For more information about how to modify these files, see USMT XML Reference.

segment.source: Fit your customized migration into your automated deployment process by using the ScanState and LoadState tools, which control collecting and restoring the user files and settings.
segment.target: Fit your customized migration into your automated deployment process by using the ScanState and LoadState tools, which control collecting and restoring the user files and settings.

segment.source: For more information, see User State Migration Tool (USMT) Command-line Syntax.
segment.target: For more information, see User State Migration Tool (USMT) Command-line Syntax.

segment.source: Perform offline migrations.
segment.target: Perform offline migrations.

segment.source: You can run migrations offline by using the ScanState command in Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) or you can perform migrations from previous installations of Windows contained in Windows.old directories.
segment.target: You can run migrations offline by using the ScanState command in Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) or you can perform migrations from previous installations of Windows contained in Windows.old directories.

segment.source: For more information about migration types, see Choose a Migration Store Type and Offline Migration Reference.
segment.target: For more information about migration types, see Choose a Migration Store Type and Offline Migration Reference.

segment.source: Benefits
segment.target: Benefits

segment.source: USMT provides the following benefits to businesses that are deploying Windows operating systems:
segment.target: USMT provides the following benefits to businesses that are deploying Windows operating systems:

segment.source: Safely migrates user accounts, operating system and application settings.
segment.target: Safely migrates user accounts, operating system and application settings.

segment.source: Lowers the cost of deploying Windows by preserving user state.
segment.target: Lowers the cost of deploying Windows by preserving user state.

segment.source: Reduces end-user downtime required to customize desktops and find missing files.
segment.target: Reduces end-user downtime required to customize desktops and find missing files.

segment.source: Reduces help-desk calls.
segment.target: Reduces help-desk calls.

segment.source: Reduces the time needed for the user to become familiar with the new operating system.
segment.target: Reduces the time needed for the user to become familiar with the new operating system.

segment.source: Increases employee satisfaction with the migration experience.
segment.target: Increases employee satisfaction with the migration experience.

segment.source: Limitations
segment.target: Limitations

segment.source: USMT is intended for administrators who are performing large-scale automated deployments.
segment.target: USMT is intended for administrators who are performing large-scale automated deployments.

segment.source: If you are only migrating the user states of a few computers, you can use Windows Easy Transfer.
segment.target: If you are only migrating the user states of a few computers, you can use Windows Easy Transfer.

segment.source: There are some scenarios in which the use of USMT is not recommended.
segment.target: There are some scenarios in which the use of USMT is not recommended.

segment.source: These include:
segment.target: These include:

segment.source: Migrations that require end-user interaction.
segment.target: Migrations that require end-user interaction.

segment.source: Migrations that require customization on a machine-by-machine basis.
segment.target: Migrations that require customization on a machine-by-machine basis.

segment.target: Related topics
